org.gearvrf.particlesystem

Class GVRSphericalEmitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • GVRSceneObject
      • org.gearvrf.particlesystem.GVRSphericalEmitter

  • public class GVRSphericalEmitter
extends GVRSceneObject
    Is a emitter in the shape of a sphere. Particles are generated randomly from within the volume of this sphere emitter of a specified radius.

      • clearSystem

        public void clearSystem()
        Unregister and remove all the child objects with meshes from this emitter

      • onDrawFrame

        protected void onDrawFrame()
        Iterate over the active meshes and delete the ones whose every particle has exceeded the maximum age limit.

        Particle meshes are generated for upto one second in the future. Therefore the maximum time particle mesh should be allowed to remain in the scene is (maxAge of the particles + one second).

      • emitWithBurstCheck

        protected void emitWithBurstCheck(float[] particlePositions,
                                  float[] particleVelocities,
                                  float[] particleTimeStamps)
        If the burst mode is on, emit the particles only once.
        Parameters:
        particlePositions -
        particleVelocities -
        particleTimeStamps -

      • setParticleVolume

        public void setParticleVolume(float width,
                              float height,
                              float depth)
        Create a bouding volume for the particle system centered at its position with the specified width, height and depth. This is important to do because the parent scene object might fall outside the viewing frustum and cause the entire system to be culled. This function creates 8 particles (mesh vertices) with very large spawning time attributes (i.e. they are always discarded) which define the volume of the system. The system is assumed to stay inside this volume.
        Parameters:
        width - volume length (along x-axis)
        height - volume height (along y-axis)
        depth - volume depth (along z-axis)

      • setEmitRate

        public void setEmitRate(int emitRate)
        Parameters:
        emitRate - The rate( #particles/second ) at which this emitter emits particles. Currently clamped to 600 particles/second.

      • getEmitRate

        public int getEmitRate()
        The rate ( #particles/second ) at which this emitter is emitting
        Returns:

      • setParticleAge

        public void setParticleAge(float age)
        The ( emit rate * age ) decide the total number of particles in the scene.
        Parameters:
        age - The time (in seconds) the particles from this emitter will remain active in the scene.

      • setParticleSize

        public void setParticleSize(float size)
        Parameters:
        size - the initial particle size.

      • setVelocityRange

        public void setVelocityRange(Vector3f minV,
                             Vector3f maxV)
        The range of velocities that a particle generated from this emitter can have.
        Parameters:
        minV - Minimum velocity that a particle can have
        maxV - Maximum velocity that a particle can have

      • setEnvironmentAcceleration

        public void setEnvironmentAcceleration(Vector3f acceleration)
        Parameters:
        acceleration - the acceleration of the environment which affects the particle motion.

      • setParticleSizeChangeRate

        public void setParticleSizeChangeRate(float rate)
        Parameters:
        rate - The rate at which the particle size should increase or decrease. Lower value clamped to 1.0f

      • setFadeWithAge

        public void setFadeWithAge(boolean fade)
        Parameters:
        fade - Set this to true to linearly decrease the transparency of the particles with their age.

      • setBurstMode

        public void setBurstMode(boolean mode)
        Parameters:
        mode - True/false to enable/disable the burst mode for this emitter.

        Parameters:
